messages.message:
Our dev setup docs (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yQOCxOISV_ukUxXdPJDoN-rERtOhdVRe7zv1swF1igw/edit?pli=1#heading=h.d0amtaabu7vy) say to install thrift==0.13.0, but I see a PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/32124) upgrading thrift to 0.14.1. Should the dev setup be updated? cc @Anil who did the upgrade.

Relatedly, do people still use our devtools python requirements37.txt? It looks like a bunch of libs there were not updated
@Heymian do you know if we're still using thrift in our platform? if not, I can clean up all the references to it

We can’t still. :disappointed: There’s lot of cleanup on the doc reader team to remove all the remaining thrift dependencies.  It’s all dead code, but they just haven’t been able to prioritize it. @Rakesh @Hari is it possible to try to get this done, thrift is really a pain to deal with.

account.thrift - Blocked on dead code in webdriver (jira (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/CS-3375))
ari.thrift - Do we even use the PageMetadata struct anymore? (jira (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/DR-687))
tesseract.thrift - Pretty sure this has been dead for years (jira (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/DR-1417))
pdfservice.thrift - pdf-service is dead

I also want to note that we’ll still depend on thrift for our python unit tests because the fake file client depends on fileservice.thrift. But this will not require any particular version of thrift, and it also won’t need to be a production code dep, just local dev + testing.
